mag.explanation: Actor-focus; future/habitual action. Used for activities that will happen or repeat.
mag.note: Used for actions that will happen or are habitual. 'nag-' would indicate past/completed.

nag.explanation: Actor-focus; completed/past action. Used for activities that have already occurred.
nag.note: Used for actions already completed. 'mag-' would indicate future/habitual.

um.explanation: Actor-focus; completed/past action (infix). Often used for spontaneous or immediate actions.
um.note: Infix 'um' indicates completed/past action. 'mag-' indicates future/habitual.

in.note: Used when the object of the verb is the focus. 'i-' is used for directive actions.

an.explanation: Locative-focus; the action affects a location or goal.
an.note: Often used when the action is directed toward a location or recipient.

i.note: Used for giving commands or emphasizing the object.

ma.note: Used for describing a state or condition.

ka.note: Used for actions done together or reciprocally.
